item.description:
Dead hiker?!?  No, just Jon Marshall chillin' on a sunny Mt. Skylight!

 

ADIRONDACK WINTER HP SERIES:

Mt. Skylight, Gray Peak and Mt. Marcy (NY High Point), from Adirondack Loj,Via Van Hoevenberg-Lake Arnold-Feldspar Brook to Lake Tear of the Clouds.


HIKE IT!


EVENT ORGANIZER: Julie Moran Contact me here: jmmoran {{ AT }} nycap.rr.com, Mobile 518-281-5882 (PLEASE, NO PHONE CALLS UNTIL THE WEEKEND OF THE EVENT). Please feel free to email me with your thoughts about this trip. WORK TOWARD YOUR WINTER ADK LIST WITH US!   Be sure to review the entire post, with information links, before you go!

LODGING FOR THIS TRIP:  The Cascade Inn (just before the left turn from Route 73 onto Adirondack Loj Road), (518) 523-2130,  $60 / night + tax, or $33 / night per person / shared room.  Please reserve early.  There is also hostel lodging across the street and also in Keene Valley (where the hike for the previous day begins).  

Plan to spend the weekend in the area; I've posted a companion event for Basin Mountain and Saddleback Mountain for the previous day.  Note that you should plan to spend the night in Schroon Lake or Keene Valley for the previous day's hike; for this hike, plan to stay near Lake Placid (see above).

 

 

Total Mileage, Total Elevation Gain, Estimated Hike Time:  About 19.2 miles RT, about 5,530' ASL (RT) vertical climbing; plan on 13 hours hike time.  

Your organizer Chris Baker, urging us on, looking down from an icy Mt. Marcy (be prepared for icy conditions on this hike!!!).

 

SPECIAL GEAR / REQUIREMENTS: NOTE: Snow shoes, poles and friction devices for boots, such as micro-spikes and / or crampons, are ESSENTIAL as added gear should wet rock surfaces freeze. Dress in non-wicking layers and bring extra gloves, socks and tops.  Be sure to have a method for backpack attachment for these items; be sure to try out your gear before you start out for your first winter trip!  Bring extra batteries!!! Test your lights!!!

CLICK HERE FOR CURRENT SNOW DEPTH INFORMATION FOR NEW YORK STATE.

 

Our 2009 group standing on a frozen Lake Tear, Mt. Marcy in back (note the Navy Seals hair styles).


UPDATES (12/28/2011 10:30 a.m.):  

Have you ever thought about hiking in the Adirondacks?  They are starkly different than any other mountains in the Northeast.  As relatively new mountains -- the result of an odd and unexplained hot spot under the earth's crust that continue to heave up dense anorthosite and other Canadian "basement" rocks -- they appear "Alp-like" in scale and character as you climb them.   More typically these hikes involve a long, gradual ascent into the back county -- and then you hit a wall and the final 1-2 miles to the summit ... and the glorious views of the Adirondack High Peaks!

 This hike starts from Adirondack Loj, passing the trail to Algonquin / Mac Range to the new Marcy Dam bypass; then to trails 68 and 73 over the long ascent to Lake Arnold, then down to the trail junction, left up Feldspar Brook to Lake Tear of the Clouds, where we'll climb Mt. Skylight.  We'll return to the western end of Lake Tear and climb the winter route to Gray Peak summit, then "bushwhack" over the snow pack to the summit of Mt. Marcy.  The descent is by the Van Hoevenberg Trail back to Adirondack Loj.

 

The view of Mt. Skylight from the summit of Mt. Marcy.


REQUIRED INBOUND ASSEMBLY POINTS (DON'T GET LOST!!!):

  • Adirondack Loj (Hike start).
  • Trail junction (trail to the right goes to the MacIntyre Range)
  • Marcy Dam area and the Hurricane Irene dam re-route
  • Van Hoevenberg / Avalanche Pass trail junction -- BEAR RIGHT -- CHECK THE BLAZE COLOR CHANGE FROM BLUE TO YELLOW.
  • Mt. Colden / Lake Arnold trail trail junction -- STAY STRAIGHT -- CHECK THE BLAZE COLOR CHANGE FROM YELLOW TO BLUE.
  • Trail junction, left turn up Feldspar Brook drainage to Lake Tear.  CHECK THE BLAZE COLOR CHANGE FROM BLUE TO YELLOW.
  • Four Corners below the trail left to Mt. Skylight (meet here 2 times)
  • Beginning of the herd path to Gray Peak at the west end of Lake Tear


CLICK THE THUMBNAIL IMAGE FOR A DETAILED MAP OF THIS AREA ...

BE PATIENT -- IMAGE IS LARGE!!!:


CLICK HERE: Google map link from Manchester, NH to the Cascade Inn, then to the Adirondack Loj parking area ($7 parking fee) and the Van Hoevenberg trailhead

Longest Estimated Drive Time From Meetup: 4 hours, 46 minutes; est. distance: 224 miles ONE WAY.


The view of the eastern Adirondack High Peaks from the Mt. Skylight summit ... Dix Mountain and the Dix Range (Hough Peak, South Dix and Macomb Mountain are visible) ... the Dial-Nippletop Range and the Colvin-Blake Range are in the foreground.

 

Things can get very weird on the summit of Skylight.

TRIP PLANNER (view / print / take with you.


NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any challenge hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going and how to get back.

WEATHER AND OTHER SUDDEN EVENTS CAN CAUSE SUDDEN CHANGES TO OR CANCELLATION OF THIS EVENT. YOU MUST CHECK BACK TO THE MEETUP.COM SITE OFTEN FOR UPDATES TO ANY HUDSON VALLEY HIKER EVENT. BY ATTENDING YOU'VE AGREED THAT YOU'VE READ INFORMATION PRESENTED HERE AND AT OUR GUIDELINES -- CLICK THE "ABOUT" LINK AT LEFT.

See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas. See you there! Julie.

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear. Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.
